title: Bourbaki–Witt theorem
summary: In mathematics, the Bourbaki–Witt theorem in order theory, named after Nicolas Bourbaki and Ernst Witt, is a basic fixed point theorem for partially ordered sets. It states that if X is a non-empty chain complete poset, and f : X → X {\displaystyle f:X\to X} such that f ( x ) ≥ x {\displaystyle f(x)\geq x} for all x , {\displaystyle x,} then f has a fixed point. Such a function f is called inflationary or progressive.
